There are several others in the school being leavened with the truth, but since these marked cases of conversion, most stringent rules have been 


                                    -89- 

made so that it is difficult to get a chance at these students. Brother Everston came to the meeting a few weeks ago when I spoke in Napier, and Sister Caro talked with him and he promised to again keep the Sabbath, and I heard read a very interesting letter from his pen of his experience.--Ms 85, 1893, pp. 10-12. (Diary, September 15, 1893.)
